label: Mount Sinai
column6: traditionally considered the mountain where Moses received the Ten Commandments
column7: and often described as a thin place.

label: Iona
column5: An island off the coast of Scotland
column6: Iona is considered a sacred site with deep Christian significance
column7: known for its ancient monastery and tranquil beauty.

label: The Burren
column6: This unique karst landscape in County Clare is a place of stark beauty
column7: with its limestone pavements and ancient dolmens. The Burren has long been regarded as a thin place
column8: where the spiritual and physical worlds intersect.

label: Rila Monastery
column6: this Orthodox Christian monastery is not only a site of religious importance but also a place where the spiritual seems to permeate the natural world. The surrounding forests and mountains add to the sense of being in a thin place.
